descriptionHtml:
[font=Verdana][center][/center][/font][center][color=#d8d8d8]
------------------------------------------[/color]
[color=#bf9000][font=Verdana][size=4]MODS: GAMEPLAY[/size][/font][/color]
------------------------------------------[/center][font=Verdana]
[color=#efefef]obviously, everybody has their own tastes when it comes to GAMEPLAY-Mods, so which ones you choose is of course totally up to you;[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
however, there is a "trifecta" of not-to-be-ignored "caveats" that MUST be followed when choosing our [/color][/font][color=#efefef]GAMEPLAY-Mods[font=Verdana]; these CAVEATS will ASSURE that the [/font]GAMEPLAY-Mods[font=Verdana] we choose WILL NOT cause performance-hits NOR the In-Game [/font][/color][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]conflicts that are the #1 cause of STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS...

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=3][u]CAVEAT-A[/u][/size][/color]

[/font][color=#efefef][font=Verdana]ALWAYS read the comments-section of Each & Every [/font]GAMEPLAY-Mod[font=Verdana] you're interested in - if you see that several peeps are posting comments 'bout the Mod causing PROBLEMS/ISSUES & the [/font][font=Verdana]MOD-Author doesn't respond regularly with EFFECTIVE troubleshooting that SOLVES the reported [/font][/color][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Problems/Issues... [/color][color=#ff0000][size=3]THEN MOVE ON[/size][/color][color=#efefef]!!!
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]i know, i know - that [/color][/font]GAMEPLAY-Mod[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] sounds SO-O-O-O-O-O-O-O COOL/AWESOME we just gotta have it, right? - well, this is when the SKYRIM "child" in us has to "grow-up" & decide whether we wanna have an "cool/awesome" Mod that causes our precious SKYRIM to "Bug-Out" or do we wanna [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Smooth-Performance SKYRIM at the minimal-cost of compromising on a Mod or two (or 3 or 4 or 5 or
6 or 7 or 8... ;-)
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#ff0000][size=3]NB[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: there are usually several [/color][/font]GAMEPLAY-Mods[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] that do similar stuff, so if that "awesome/cool" Mod you want is reported as
being "big-trouble" by peeps' comments, search for similar mods - [i]chances are you'll find a similar [/i][/color][/font]GAMEPLAY-Mod[font=Verdana][color=#efefef][i] that works very well...

[/i][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=3][u]CAVEAT-B[/u][/size][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
just HOW MANY [/color][/font]GAMEPLAY-Mods[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] do we have that you ACTUALLY USE REGULARLY? - most of us have at least a handful
(more-often-than-not DOZENS) that we rarely if ever use & TRULY ENJOY when [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000]IMMERSED-IN-GAMEPLAY

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]so, again, time for our innerSKYRIMchild to grow-up & seriously consider ONLY choosing [/color][/font]GAMEPLAY-Mods[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] that we're sure we're gonna actually USE/ENJOY while [/color][color=#bf9000]IMMERSED-IN-GAMEPLAY[/color]

[/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=3][u]CAVEAT-C[/u][/size][/color]

[/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]install just ONE ([size=4]1[/size]) [/color][/font]GAMEPLAY-Mod[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] at a time, then [size=3]TEST[/size] using the comprehensive "[/color][color=#bf9000]PERFORMANCE MONITORING PROCEDURE for TESTING GAMEPLAY MODS[/color][color=#efefef]" below;
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]YES, this is indeed very tedious & time-consuming (but yet FUN, yes? - lol) to take this level of care BUT if having a
Smooth-Performance SKYRIM is our utmost-desire, then this is [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]the ONLY way to assure the [/color][/font]GAMEPLAY-Mods[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] we choose will not hamper that...

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#ff0000][size=3]FOR LOW-END PC[/size][/color][color=#efefef]'s: You CAN & SHOULD Use the INFO in this above Category



[/color][/font][center][color=#d8d8d8]--------------------------------------------------------[/color]
[color=#bf9000][font=Verdana][size=4]GAMEPLAY PARADIGM "B"[/size][/font][/color]
--------------------------------------------------------[/center][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]there are basically TWO (2) TYPES of SKYRIM "Play-Styles": (1) the [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000]IMMERSED-IN-GAMEPLAY[/color][color=#efefef] style described above [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]& (2) the just "[/color][color=#bf9000]Fiddling-Around with MODS[/color][color=#efefef]" style...[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]...to SUCCESSFULLY achieve a Smooth-Performance SKYRIM [NO-STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS] while using ANY/ALL Mods we desire, this Guide DIFFERENTIATES between these TWO (2) TYPES of SKYRIM Play-Styles
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Let's consider those DIFFERENCES... [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]the [/color][color=#bf9000]IMMERSED-IN-GAMEPLAY[/color][color=#efefef] ["[/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]IiGP[/size][/color][color=#efefef]"] vs [/color][color=#bf9000]Fiddling-Around with MODS[/color][color=#efefef] ["[/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]FAwM[/size][/color][color=#efefef]"] styles… (cute "acronyms" huh? - lol - gotta keep this shyt FUN [img]http://www.freesmileys.org/smileys/smiley-laughing001.gif[/img][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana]
[color=#bf9000][size=4][u]IiGP[/u][/size][/color]

[/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]when [/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]IiGP[/size][/color][color=#efefef], do we bounce around from QUEST-to-QUEST within a [size=3]SINGLE Play-Thru[/size]? [size=1]~[/size] of course not, we're way too BUSY trying to complete the current QUEST we're involved in...
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]when [/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]IiGP[/size][/color][color=#efefef], do we just sit & stare meticulously at those spectacular 4K-Textures? [/color][/font]~[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] of course we don't, we're way too FOCUSED to really notice them...
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]when [/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]IiGP[/size][/color][color=#efefef], do we actually live in all our many Script-Heavy custom Player-Homes at the same time within a SINGLE[/color]
[color=#efefef]Play-Thru [/color][/font]~[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] of course we don't, we're ENGROSSED in enjoying the[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]one (1) we're currently living in...
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4][u]FAwM[/u][/size][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana]
[color=#efefef]when [/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]FAwM[/size][/color][color=#efefef], we DO bounce around from QUEST-to-QUEST within a SINGLE Play-Thru just for the hell-of-it...
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]result:  STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana]
[color=#efefef]when [/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]FAwM[/size][/color][color=#efefef], we DO "Sit & Stare" meticulously at those spectacular 4K-Textures...
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]result:  STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]when [/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]FAwM[/size][/color][color=#efefef], we DO "live" in all our many Script-Heavy custom Player-Homes within a SINGLE Play-Thru just for the hell-of-it...
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]result:  STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]the purpose of this Guide is to indeed create the EXPERIENCE of a Smooth-Performance SKYRIM [NO-STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS] while using ANY/ALL Mods we desire - The "[/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]PRIMARY EXPERIENCE[/size][/color][color=#efefef]" - which is truly possible ONLY when [/color][color=#bf9000][size=4]IiGP[/size][/color]


[/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]but The [/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]FAwM [/size][/color][color=#efefef]Experience is alotta FUN too!!! - YES, the rest of this Guide will indeed create that experience as well, BUT towards successfully creating The [/color][color=#bf9000]PRIMARY EXPERIENCE[/color]

[/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]so, keep these SIX (6) "[/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]IiGP[/size][/color][color=#efefef]" vs "[/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]FAwM[/size][/color][color=#efefef]" differences in-mind, 'cause the rest of this Guide is firmly based on this "paradigm" [img]http://www.freesmileys.org/smileys/smiley-happy045.gif[/img]



[/color][/font][center][color=#d8d8d8]---------------------------------[/color]
[color=#bf9000][font=Verdana][size=4]uGridsToLoad[/size][/font][/color]
---------------------------------[/center][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]for the most part, uGridsToLoad is a HUGE NoNoNo - however, there are indeed ways to get the same Visual-FX of, for example, uGridsToLoad 7-9 WITHOUT the inevitable CDT
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]also, even with the great MOD "CellStabilizer" above, unless you have a Super-Power PC (e.g.,[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]8+ PHYSICAL Cores, not 4 HyperThreaded Cores; NVIDIA QUADRO SLI; 32+GB RAM) you will ONLY be able to use uGridsToLoad 7-9+ for taking "static" ScreenShots (which of course is awesome in & of itself)
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]furthermore, even with a Super-Powered PC, using uGridsToLoad 7-9+ will significantly interfere with In-Game QUESTS (e.g., you'll enter a Cell to begin a Quest & instantly DIE - lol - the reasons for these issues & much more useful info are fully explained in-depth in this excellent resource here: [/color][size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/48387/?]uGridsToLoad[/url][/size][color=#efefef] (but [/color][color=#ff0000][size=3]DO NOT[/size][/color][color=#efefef] follow any of the instructions there if you are using [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]this GUIDE, as per the "[/color][color=#bf9000]PERFORMANCE "INI" TWEAKS[/color][color=#efefef]" category above)
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][size=4][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xz91izr8SiE]uGridsToLoad VIDEO Tutorial/Demonstration[/url] [/size][In-Game/Real-Time]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]nevertheless, "CellStabilizer" does MORE than just uGridsToLoad - it also allows for fairly "unknown" but [/color][size=3]VERY[/size][color=#efefef] effective INI "lines" to be utilized; we've thoroughly-tested & included these "lines" in the complete-set of INI-Tweaks in the DL-Section (you can also read what all these "lines" actually DO via the [/color][color=#6d9eeb]LINK[/color][color=#efefef] above, [/color][color=#ff0000][size=3]BUT DO NOT[/size][/color][color=#efefef] add any of the other "lines" found there to the INI-Tweaks we've provided in the DL-Section... [/color][color=#ff0000]NO MATTER HOW GREAT THEY SOUND[/color][color=#efefef] [img]http://www.freesmileys.org/smileys/smiley-angry006.gif[/img][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana]
[color=#efefef]so, uGridsToLoad? !!![/color][color=#ff0000][size=3]FIVE[/size][/color][color=#efefef]!!! ;-)[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana]
[color=#ff0000][size=3]NB[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: thru the forums, some SKYRIMer's report using uGridsToLoad 7-9+ WITHOUT experiencing ANY issues/problems - we've found that this is due to the "VARIANCES" sometimes present similar [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]PC-Components; i.e., the SAME Model GPU/CPU made by DIFFERENT manufacturers sometimes "Bench-Mark" completely differently (EXAMPLE: CPU/GPU BenchMark STATS [[url=http://www.videocardbenchmark.net/]LINK[/url] & [url=http://www.videocardbenchmark.net/]LINK[/url]]; this is no-doubt why some SKYRIMer's (VERY FEW) report "no-problem/issue" experiences with [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]uGridsToLoad 7-9+; the purpose of this Guide, tho, is to provide the INFO that WORKS for [size=3]ALL[/size] PC's regardless of these PC-Component VARIANCES
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][color=#ff0000][size=3]FOR LOW-END PC[/size][/color]'s: [color=#ff0000][size=3]DO NOT USE[/size][/color] the INI-Tweaks Files in the DL-Section, simply use the ORIGINAL INI's generated by SKYRIM, [color=#ff0000][size=3]ALONG WITH[/size][/color] the INI-Tweaks Recommended by STEP



[center][color=#d8d8d8]---------------------------------[/color]
[color=#bf9000][font=Verdana][size=4]Over-Clocking[/size][/font][/color]
---------------------------------[/center][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]we have found thru our extensive-testing on multiple PC's of varying specs that Over-Clocking the GPU/CPU within "[size=3]SAFE[/size]" parameters has VERY LITTLE significant-impact on Performance-Enhancement in SKYRIM; however, if you want that
"warm-fuzzy" feeling that Over-Clocking provides - lol - we only recommend that you do so within such "[size=3]SAFE[/size]" parameters (GOOGLE'n the subject-matter based on your specific CPU/GPU [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]will provide you with lots of great info - but [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]be VERY careful, as just ONE mistake can FRY your GPU/CPU); but, again, it will have VERY LITTLE significant-impact on SKYRIM Performance-Enhancement, so unless you also use your PC for GPU/CPU-intensive work (as we do for CGI/Editing/SFX in filmmaking) we HIGHLY encourage you [/color][color=#ff0000]LEAVE YOUR CPU/GPU ALONE[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]

[/color][/font][color=#ff0000][size=3]FOR LOW-END PC[/size][/color][color=#efefef]'s: You CAN & SHOULD Use the INFO in this above Category



[/color][center][color=#d8d8d8]--------------------------------------[/color]
[color=#bf9000][font=Verdana][size=4]ENB vs SweetFX[/size][/font][/color]
--------------------------------------[/center][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]ENB's are AWESOME of course, but other than choosing based on your particular [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]visual-tastes, you MUST of course choose based on your PC-Specs (most ENB Authors clearly specify their recommended specs - [size=3]LISTEN TO THEM[/size][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]

HOWEVER, if you take the time as we have to thoroughly test In-Game all the ENB's out [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]there & compare them with the EQUALLY AWESOME [size=3]SweetFX[/size], you'll notice that most of the ENB visuals that cause the most performance-hits are the ones that are the LEAST noticeable [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]In-Game while [/color][color=#bf9000]IMMERSED-IN-GAMEPLAY[/color][color=#efefef] (please see the "[/color][/font][color=#bf9000][size=2]Proof-of-Concept SCREENSHOTS[/size][/color][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]" below);[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
so, if your PC-specs meet (preferably exceed) the ENB Authors' recommended specs, then by all means use your fav ENB[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
but, if your PC-specs fall short of the recommended, there's no-doubt a SweetFx that will [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]more-than-satisfy your
intense-visuals desire – our PC-Specs at the Film Prod. Studio far exceed the [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]recommended specs for any ENB, yet we've tried ALL the ENB's out there & because of our particular visual-tastes, we indeed currently use a SweetFX that most closely gives us the visuals we desire...
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]...basically, there are Three (3) Types of [size=3]ENB/SweetFX[/size]: [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef](1) FANTASY (2) REALISM (3) PERFORMANCE

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]all "performance" ENB's enhance visuals significantly LESS than most SweetFX, so we're only gonna cover FANTASY & REALISIM

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]just as ENB's, SweetFX has countless presets avail for DL in both FANTASY & REALISM - the SweetFX website has comparison GIF's [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef](Vanilla vs SweetFX vs ENB) of most of them, so head-on over & enjoy checkin' them all out:[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/23364/?]SweetFX [/url][size=2]~[/size][size=3] [url=http://sfx.thelazy.net/games/]SweetFX [PreSets DataBase][/url] [/size][size=2]~[/size][size=3] [url=http://sweetfx.thelazy.net/]SweetFX CONFIGURATOR[/url][/size]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]as with all ENB's avail, we've also thoroughly tested all SweetFX avail - they're ALL awesome as all ENB's are awesome, but our particular visual-taste is REALISM - we like SKYRIM to look like "video/film" in that when [/color][/font]IMMERSED-IN-GAMEPLAY[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] it's virtually like looking at real [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]live-action video/film (we're filmmakers afterall - lol)
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]so for those who share our visual-tastes (for those of us who prefer FANTASY visuals, again just enjoy checkin' the
SweetFX website's out, you're sure to find one that'll THRILL you) there's [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]only ONE SweetFX (to-date) that we WHOLEHEARTEDLY recommend (the ONLY one we currently use) in terms of STARTLING REALISM - it's called [size=3]D.E.R.P.[/size] ~ [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57242/?tab=4&&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fcomments%2F%3Fmod_id%3D57242%26page%3D1%26sort%3DDESC%26pid%3D0%26thread_id%3D2027669&pUp=1][size=3]D.E.R.P. Ultra-Realism SweetFX[/size][/url] (creating this visual-style was the MOD-Author's sole intent, so he seems to have gone MIA from NEXUS now that his work/sharin' is done)[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#ff0000][size=3]NB[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: the Mod's Author [/color][i][please see FULL Credits-List below][/i][color=#efefef] actually created a [/color][size=3]SweetFX/ENB[/size][color=#efefef] "hybrid" of D.E.R.P. (there are also several such ENB/SweetFX HYBRIDS out there too you should definitely check-out) but scrapped the idea [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]after months of work because thru In-Game tests there was LITERALLY no significant visual-enhancement noticeable while [/color][/font]IMMERSED-IN-GAMEPLAY[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] so the potential performance-hit was just not worth it[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#ff0000][size=3]PS[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: "BOKEH DOF" is of course the "sweetheart" of ENB, but also the MOST [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]performance-hit; D.E.R.P. utilizes the FANTASTIC Mod "[size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12525/?]DYNAVISION[/url][/size]" which has many DOF pre-sets, the "Dynamic/Soft-Focus" pre-set rivaling BOKEH, without ANY performance-hit (again see [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]"[/color][/font][color=#bf9000][size=2]Proof-of-Concept SCREENSHOTS[/size][/color][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]"[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef] below)
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#ff0000][size=3]FOR LOW-END PC[/size][/color][color=#efefef]'s: You Can Use ANY SweetFX You Wish - [/color][color=#ff0000][size=3]DO NOT[/size][/color][color=#efefef] USE ENB's



[/color][/font][center][color=#d8d8d8]-----------------[/color]
[color=#bf9000][font=Verdana][size=4]HDT[/size][/font][/color]
-----------------[/center][font=Verdana]
[/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]thru thorough-testing of all HDT Mods avail, rest-assured that you can use ANY Mod utilizing HDT that you wish, as there is absolutely NO performance-hits whatsoever on PC's that meet/exceed the [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]recommended-minimum SPECS detailed above...
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#ff0000][size=3]FOR LOW-END PC[/size][/color][color=#efefef]'s: You Can Use [size=3]BASIC[/size] HDT Mods (the ones that consist of ONLY the BASIC "hdtPhysicsExtensionsDefaultBBP.xml" file WITHOUT "Breast-Collision"); for[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]"Breast-Collison" ADD the "HAVOK OBJECT" HDT Breast-Collision ALTERNATIVE (Works [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Perfectly): [/color][url=http://www.loverslab.com/index.php?app=core&module=attach§ion=attach&attach_id=52325]HAVOK-OBJECT[/url][color=#efefef]; [/color][color=#ff0000][size=3]DO NOT USE[/size][/color][color=#efefef] ANY OF THE "ADVANCED" HDT MODS (HAIR/TAILS/BELLY)



[/color][/font][center][color=#d8d8d8]----------------------[/color]
[color=#bf9000][font=Verdana][size=4]ZAZ/SL[/size][/font][/color]
----------------------[/center][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
for those of us who enjoy the "naughtier/raunchier" side of SKYRIM - lol - ZAZ/SL provides UNBELIEVABLY REALISTIC MODS, all of which we've tested thoroughly & have NO performance-hit at all (even on[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]"Low-End" PC's)
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]HOWEVER, many mods DO conflict, so you must choose wisely/discerningly - ZAZ/SL MOD-Authors are VERY good at documenting which MODS conflict with eachother, so all one needs to do [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]is Thoroughly/Carefully read each MOD description b/4 choosing;
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]also, ZAZ/SL MOD-Authors are CONSTANTLY updating their MODS (sometimes several times a week) which of course is a GREAT thing, but of course it means requires VIGILANCE to keep your MODS in perfect working-order[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#ff0000][size=3]NB[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: for those of us unaware, ZAZ/SL MODS are NOT only 'bout "nasty" stuff - lol - there [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]are MANY "wholesome" ZAZ/SL MODS too that provide the experience of "Making-Love" (e.g., Marriage/Pregnancy/Courtship, etc)
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]'NUFF SAID (lol)
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#ff0000][size=3]FOR LOW-END PC[/size][/color][color=#efefef]'s: YOU CAN USE ANY ZAZ/SL MODS YOU WISH



[/color][/font][center][color=#d8d8d8]---------------------------------[/color]
[color=#bf9000][font=Verdana][size=4]MOD-Merging[/size][/font][/color]
---------------------------------[/center][font=Verdana]
[/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]this VERY EFFECTIVE technique used to be a VERY difficult procedure to understand much less effectively implement, but with the advent of the current-version of "[size=3]WYRE BASH[/size]" [Vers. 305], it's fairly simple [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]indeed - plus it's virtually "AUTOMATIC" now so you can't make ANY mistakes, [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]as WyreBash now alerts you to which MODS can be merged [size=3]SAFELY[/size] & which MODS can't (similar to how [size=3]LOOT[/size] now alerts you of potential Mod Install-Order issues after sorting Mod Load-Order)

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]with WyreBash [i][by legendary MOD-Author, see FULL Credits-List below][/i] you create the AWESOME "[size=3]BashedPatch[/size]" which now includes MOD-Merging (a detailed [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]history/explanation of WyreBash can be found on the STEP "[/color][color=#bf9000]BASICS of INSTALLATION[/color][color=#efefef]" category [/color][color=#6d9eeb]LINK [/color][color=#efefef]above, as it's a [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]MAJOR aspect of STEP Installation & SKYRIM Game-Maintenance)
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Simple MOD-Merging Instructions for WyreBash: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/oblivion/mods/35230/?][size=3]WyreBash PICTORIAL Guide[/size][/url] (it's based on OBLIVION but same procedure for SKYRIM)
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Extensive WyreBash Guide (STEP): [size=3][url=http://wiki.step-project.com/Guide:Wrye_Bash]WyreBash EXTENSIVE Guide[/url][/size]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1840/?][size=3]WyreBash[/size][/url] (NEXUS)

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][color=#ff0000][size=3]FOR LOW-END PC[/size][/color][color=#efefef]'s: You CAN & SHOULD Use the INFO in this above Category



[/color][center][color=#d8d8d8]-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/color]
[color=#bf9000][size=4]USING UNLIMITED MODS WITHOUT PERFORMANCE-HITS[/size][/color]
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center][color=#efefef]
[/color][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]this is that EXTRA-SPECIAL "secret" that allows the successful creation of the [/color][color=#bf9000]PRIMARY EXPERIENCE [/color][color=#efefef]as detailed above...

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]...we came across it on an ASIAN website dedicated to SKYRIM that we haven't seen anywhere else on dozens-upon-dozens of similar websites we've found over the past 2-yrs; it's simply "out-the-box" thinkin' that requires just [size=3]a good bit of extra Care/Time[/size][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana]

[color=#efefef]remember the "[/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]IiGP[/size][/color][color=#efefef]" vs "[/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]FAwM[/size][/color][color=#efefef]" INFO above? [size=1]~[/size] bring it to-mind now (if there ever was a [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]"magic-bullet" that would solve all SKYRIM performance-issues (of course there's not) but this is indeed as close to it as we can imagine - plus it's [size=3]brilliantly simple[/size]):

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=3][u]the CONCEPT[/u][/size][/color]
[/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]so, we have 300+ Mods installed THAT WE CAN'T LIVE WITHOUT & thus our beloved SKYRIM suffers from [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]well, again seriously consider HOW MANY of those MODS do we actually USE during a SINGLE Play-Thru (e.g., a 3-HR session)? [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]obviously, not all of them & most likely only approx. 50-75% of them - which means we're sacrificing 25-50% of the PC's resources for MANY MODS Running-in-the-Background that we'[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]re NOT actually Experiencing/Enjoying...
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=3][u]the "SECRET"[/u][/size][/color]
[/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]the elegant "[size=3]why didn't we think of that[/size]" concept we found on this ASIAN website [url=http://skyrimghost.blog.fc2.com/][LINK (warning: site includes ADULT material)][/url] is indeed brilliantly simple - it simply [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Incorporates EFFECTIVELY ModOrganizer's EXCELLENT Feature: [size=3]MULTIPLE MOD PROFILES
[/size][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]thru Multiple MOD Profiles (MMP's), we can choose which Individual-MMP we're gonna use, dependent on exactly what we
actually are in-the-mood to do in SKYRIM during a SINGLE Play-Thru [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]session - each Individual-MMP will have ONLY the MODS running that are ACTUALLY USED for whatever we know we will be doing in SKYRIM during that particular SINGLE Play-Thru session;
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]which FREE-UP that 25-50% PC-Resources, obviously resulting in much-greater Smooth SKYRIM Performance, which of course in-turn VIRTUALLY ELIMINATES STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS...
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=3][u]the RESULTS[/u][/size][/color]
[/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]YES, Multiple MOD Profiles [size=3]WILL[/size] take a good bit of Thought/Planning, BUT it's virtually one of the #1 things in this entire GUIDE that has proven to make our SKYRIM run [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]SMOOTH-AS-BUTTER [img]http://www.freesmileys.org/smileys/smiley-happy085.gif[/img][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
so now we have the Best-Of-Both-Worlds in that we can use virtually an UNLIMITED # of MODS we want using ONLY the MODS we'll be actually Experiencing/Enjoying in that SINGLE [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Play-Thru session...
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]to make Implementing MMP's crystal-clear, this is the procedure we use (just follow it according to your own personal "Play-Style"):[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]1st[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: make a BASE MMP that includes ONLY the STEP Core-Mods plus the [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Performance-Enhancement MODS recommended in this Guide above; this BASE MMP will be the fundamental MMP upon which each other MMP will be made from

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]2nd[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: note the OVERALL "[size=3]ACTIVITIES[/size]" of things you do in SKYRIM during a[size=3] [/size][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][size=3]SINGLE Play-Thru[/size] session; in our case, we generally do [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Three (3) Things [size=1]~[/size] (1) QUESTS (2) ZAZ/SL (3) SANDBOX Free-Roam EXPLORE

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]3rd[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: make an Individual-MMP for each OVERALL "ACTIVITY" - in our case obviously we make 3 MMP's, Re-Named in MO as named above[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]4th[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: we then go thru our list of MODS (currently 322) & for each Individual-MMP we select ONLY the MODS that are ESSENTIAL for that particular SINGLE Play-Thru session

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]so, for example, if we're in-the-mood to SANDBOX Free-Roam EXPLORE, we will [size=3]NOT[/size] choose any of the 8 Script-Heavy
custom Player-Homes we have 'cause we obviously won't be using them; if we're [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]in-the-mood for ZAZ/SL, we won't choose any MODS that don't DIRECTLY relate to WHERE we'll be enjoying our "Love-Making" exploits (lol); if we're in-the-mood for a QUEST, we will ONLY choose the MODS that affect the SPECIFIC QUEST we're gonna play-thru[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]with just a bit of Fine-Tuning & some EXTRA Time in Thought/Planning, you'll [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]no-doubt be VERY surprised at how many MODS you will choose not using for each [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Individual-MMP; moreso, if you're anything like us (it THRILLED us when we saw what [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]a phenomenal difference it made compared to running all 322-Mods simultaneously), you'll feel an "exhilaration", especially if you've already become accustomed to "suffering" thru STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]plus, of course, with ModOrganizer - we can now have as MANY Individual-MMP's as we want...


...thusly, via MMP's we successfully create the [/color][color=#bf9000]PRIMARY EXPERIENCE[/color][color=#efefef] of "[/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]IiGP[/size][/color][color=#efefef]" with Smooth NO-STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS Performance


[/color][/font][color=#ff0000][size=3]FOR LOW-END PC[/size][/color][color=#efefef]'s: You CAN & SHOULD Use the INFO in this above Category



[/color][center]* * *[/center][color=#efefef]
[/color][center][color=#d8d8d8]----------------------------------------------------------------[/color]
[color=#bf9000][font=Verdana][size=4]Non-Optional TIPS [Must-Use][/size][/font][/color]
----------------------------------------------------------------[/center][color=#efefef]

[center]* * *[/center]
[/color][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]T1[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: PLAY an Un-Modded SKYRIM (BASE MMP as detailed above) for a coupla hrs; invariably, there will be alotta moments when we'll get the feeling of "wish this/that was better, wish this/that looked more realistic, wish this/that was more convenient" (etc, etc, etc); jot down quick notes 'bout these & then search for MODS based on your notes - this will ASSURE we only choose MODS that we'll [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]actually Use/Enjoy based on our In-Game desires (rather than browsing all NEXUS Mods which invariably causes us to choose Mods based just on The "Sounds Cool" Factor thus cluttering our SKYRIM with many Mods we'll rarely Use/Enjoy while [/color][color=#bf9000]IMMERSED-IN-GAMEPLAY[/color][color=#efefef]; after doing this & we have all the MODS we want based on our actual In-Game desires, we can
then of course browse to our [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Heart's Content - lol - but now already having what we TRULY desire we'll be way more "discerning" as to what additional "Cool-Factor" MODS we'll choose

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][center]* * *[/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]T2[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: NEVER use AUTO-SAVE and/or QUICK-SAVE (WHY? [[url=http://www.techspot.com/review/467-skyrim-performance/]LINK[/url]]; ALWAYS use NEW-SAVE; better yet, [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]use Console-Command SAVE 'NAME' & choose a meaningful name that will remind you of what is incorporated in that Save-Game (WHY? [[url=http://www.techspot.com/review/467-skyrim-performance/]LINK[/url]]


[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][center]* * *[/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]T3[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: ONLY use MUSIC-Replacers that are Well-Known/Well-Documented to [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]work WITHOUT Issues/Problems; MUSIC-Replacers are a MAJOR cause of CDT's/ILS's (WHY? [[url=http://www.techspot.com/review/467-skyrim-performance/]LINK[/url]]

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][center]* * *[/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]T4[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: NEVER Un-Install a MOD that uses SCRIPTS & save that same game; after uninstalling REVERT to the last-save which didn't incorporate the [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Scripted-Mod (WHY? [[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53045/?]LINK [/url]& [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53045/?]LINK[/url]]; uninstalling an ESP/BSA-only Mod is usually safe to save same game, but one of the MAJOR "mottos" this Guide is based on is "If It MAY HELP But Definitely WON'T HURT, Then WHY NOT" (so revert to last-save game after uninstall in these cases as well)

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][center]* * *[/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]T5[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: perhaps "obvious" but in our research-experience found it to be often over-looked: if you begin experiencing CDT's/FREEZES/ILS's all-of-a-sudden on a Save-Game that was working well & you HAVE NOT installed ANY new MODS,
Re-Start your PC (better yet, Turn-Off, wait approx. 20-secs, then [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Turn-On again); WINDOWS will sometimes continue running a program's files in the background (so just Re-Starting SKYRIM won't solve the issue) & ONLY doing this will "Re-Set" the program (happens all the time in 3D-CGI/SFX Editing, which 3D-Gaming run VERY similar to)
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]this ALSO applies to WyreBash & anytime you install a New-MOD: if after creating [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]the BashedPatch and/or installing a New-MOD you experience CDT's/FREEZES/ILS's immediately afterwards, Re-Start/Re-Boot your PC as described above (we found approx. 65% of the time this will solve the issue)

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][center]* * *[/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]T6[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: ModOrganizer (MO) is an ABSOLUTE MUST, PERIOD, NO EXCEPTIONS - as good [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]as NMM is, ModOrganizer's "virtual" tech leaves the Original SKYRIM Installation (VANILLA) completely UNTOUCHED; NMM, due to HDD-fragmentation among other things, ALWAYS there is RISK of leaving fragments behind (causing all sorts of Issues/Problems); HOWEVER, if installing SKYRIM on SDD, that may not be an issue with NMM 'cause they don't fragment, BUT the other MAJOR "motto" this Guide is based on is indeed the cliche "Better SAFE Than SORRY"

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][center]* * *[/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]T7[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: after playing a few hrs or more & with NO Issues/Problems whatsoever - SAVE THAT GAME (WHY? [[url=http://www.techspot.com/review/467-skyrim-performance/]LINK[/url]]


[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][center]* * *[/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]T8[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: LET SKYRIM "BREATH": a lil' patience goes a long way (e.g., don't RUSH from[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]"Fast-Travel" to "Fast-Travel"; upon entering a NEW CELL give SKYRIM a chance to "catch-up" b/4 entering another NEW CELL; a Heavily-Modded SKYRIM takes a good while to FULLY-LOAD when entering NewCells - even on SDD - so if you go-on to do something else immediately, the Un-Loaded parts will invariably cause CDT's/FREEZING/ILS's

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][center]* * *[/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana]
[color=#bf9000][size=4]T9[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: uGridsToLoad 7-9+ obviously makes a HUGE difference in how good SKYRIM looks IN THE FAR DISTANCE, but of course using 7-9+ is not stable - the great Mod "CellStabilizer" (aka "STABLEuGridsToLoad") DOES NOT make uGridsToLoad 7-9+ STABLE (again, read the Mod's NEXUS main-page-description Thoroughly/Carefully, it ONLY makes it possible to SAFELY TEST higher uGridsToLoad [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]In-Game while allowing to revert back to "Default-5" without affecting your Save-Game)


[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][center]* * *[/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]T10[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: perhaps also "obvious" but in our research-experience found it to be also often over-looked: if your SKYRIM Install is on an HDD (as opposed to an SSD) you MUST DEFRAGMENT REGULARLY - [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]it DOES INDEED make a HUGE difference in Smooth SKYRIM Performance (we utilize a "Render-Farm" setup at the Film Prod. Studio, consisting of 8 PC's that run simultaneously rendering a specific project; when we compare Real-Time PERFORMANCE Bench-Mark Stats BEFORE/AFTER defragmentation (we defragment all our PC's once-per-week) there is a HUGE difference in Render-Time bet the [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]NON-DeFragmented & DeFragmented stats (3D-SFX/CGI/VFX Rendering is very similar to running 3D-Games)


[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][center]* * *[/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]T11[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: the SIZE & QUALITY of the HD-Textures you choose greatly depends on the SIZE & QUALITY of your PC's MONITOR; e.g., unless you have a 40+" 1080p HD Monitor, 4K-Textures will barely be noticeable [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]In-Game while [/color][/font]IMMERSED-IN-GAMEPLAY[font=Verdana][color=#efefef]; if your Monitor is HD (720p min) bet. 24-32" (any smaller & even 1K-Textures will not be greatly noticeable) then 1K-Textures will make a HUGE difference when [/color][/font]IMMERSED-IN-GAMEPLAY[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] (provided of course your PC meets/exceeds min-specs above); 2K-Textures only cost approx. 2-6FPS, so it's definitely playable BUT also not that greater a difference in noticeability while [/color][/font]IMMERSED-IN-GAMEPLAY[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] compared to 1K-Textures (please see [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]"[/color][/font][size=2]Proof-of-Concept SCREENSHOTS[/size][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]"[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef] below)


[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][center]* * *[/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]T12[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: installing SKYRIM on its own dedicated SDD Greatly/Significantly improves [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Loading-Times & Lag/Stutter, so of course it is HIGHLY recommended (however it does NOT significantly affect CDT's/FREEZE/ILS's); in lieu of SDD, it is still IDEAL to install SKYRIM on its own dedicated [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]HDD (you will notice CONSIDERABLE improvement)


[/color][/font][center]* * *[/center][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]T13[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: after sorting your MODS with [size=3]LOOT[/size] (an absolute MUST of course) ALWAYS clean any MOD that LOOT recommends with TES5EDIT (WHY? [[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fw3g_N1jcZQ]LINK[/url]]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef][size=3][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fw3g_N1jcZQ]TES5EDIT CleaningGuide[/url]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/?]TES5EDIT[/url][/size] (NEXUS)



[/color][/font][color=#ff0000][size=3]FOR LOW-END PC[/size][/color][color=#efefef]'s: You CAN & SHOULD Use the INFO in this above Category



[/color][center][font=Verdana][color=#000000][size=6]* * *[/size][/color][/font][/center][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][center][color=#d8d8d8]-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/color]
[color=#bf9000][size=4]PERFORMANCE MONITORING PROCEDURE for TESTING GAMEPLAY MODS[/size][/color]
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]this is of course the most time-consuming category in the this whole Guide...

[center][img]http://www.freesmileys.org/smileys/smiley-angry031.gif[/img][/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]...however, it is also the MOST IMPORTANT/EFFECTIVE aspect towards SUCCESSFULLY ACHIEVING a Smooth-Performance SKYRIM 

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]for those of us who also enjoy The [/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]FFwM[/size][/color][color=#efefef] Experience as much (or "almost" as much - lol) [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]as The [/color][color=#bf9000]PRIMARY EXPERIENCE[/color][color=#efefef], then this "procedure" will be a welcomed effort, as it of course indeed creates that experience;

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]for those of us who DON'T necessarily also enjoy [/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]FAwM [/size][/color][color=#efefef]& just (understandably) can't wait to "revel" in The [/color][color=#bf9000]PRIMARY EXPERIENCE[/color][color=#efefef], think of it this way: this "procedure" only has to be done ONCE (per MOD - lol) & it is the [size=4]#1[/size] aspect (along with all the other categories in this Guide) [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]that GUARANTEES the SUCCESSFUL ACHIEVEMENT of a [/color][/font]NO-STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS] [font=Verdana][color=#efefef]Smooth-Performance SKYRIM while using ANY/ALL Mods we desire thru [/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]IiGP[/size][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
so, again, just have FUN with it...

[center][img]http://www.freesmileys.org/smileys/smiley-happy065.gif[/img][/center][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana]
[color=#bf9000][size=3][u]PMRTGM[/u][/size][/color]

[color=#efefef]when installing a NEW GAMEPLAY-Mod (as per MOD-Installation "[/color][color=#bf9000]CAVEAT-C[/color][color=#efefef]" in "[/color][color=#bf9000]MODS: GAMEPLAY[/color][color=#efefef]" category), TEST [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]In-Game using the following procedure for approx. 20-mins:

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=4]A[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: FAST-TRAVEL to ALL the Major-Holds 3X EACH & Run-Around for a few mins, as well as Enter/Exit several different CELLS in each Major-Hold; if all goes WELL IN EVERY WAY (NO-STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS), SAVE (as per SAVE-Instructions detailed above in "[/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]T2[/size][/color][color=#efefef]") & then Install your next NEW [/color][/font]GAMEPLAY-Mod[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] & [/color][size=3]Re-Test

[/size][color=#bf9000][size=4]B[/size][/color][color=#efefef]: if all DOES NOT go well IN ANY WAY, Un-Install that [/color][/font]GAMEPLAY-Mod[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] (as per "[/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]T4[/size][/color][color=#efefef]" UNINSTALL-Instructions above) & [size=3]Re-Test[/size] (if all goes well in-every-way now, [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]obviously it's a MOD-Issue/Problem of some sort with that specific MOD)

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]testing each individual [/color][/font]GAMEPLAY-Mod[font=Verdana][color=#efefef] in this way will very easily SINGLE-OUT any MOD that will cause Issues/Problems, after which we can search the MOD's support-forums to see if other peeps are having similar Issues/Problems & also see if the MOD-Author and/or SKYRIMer's have [/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]posted Solution(s)/Work-Around(s); if not, as stated above, LET THE MOD GO & search for similar working alternative MODs ;-)

[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][color=#ff0000][size=3]FOR LOW-END PC[/size][/color][color=#efefef]'s: You CAN & SHOULD Use the INFO in this above Category



[/color][center][font=Verdana][color=#000000][size=6]* * *[/size][/color][/font][/center]

[color=#bf9000][size=4]Wrap-Up of The USPSR300-GPT Guide[/size][/color]
---------------------------------------------------------------------[/center][color=#efefef]

[/color][font=Verdana][color=#bf9000][size=3]WE HAVE NOW COMPLETED UTILIZING[/size][/color][color=#efefef] "[/color][color=#bf9000][size=3]The GUIDE[/size][/color][color=#efefef]" [img]http://www.freesmileys.org/smileys/smiley-excited001.gif[/img][/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana][color=#efefef]
[/color][/font][font=Verdana]
[color=#d8d8d8]...if you have indeed utilized this guide by C[i]arefully/Thoroughly reading it in its ENTIRETY word-for-word & then following Each & Every STEP-BY-STEP Instruction to-the-letter in Each & Every CATEGORY[/i] (yep, we kept our promise to indeed repeat that Ad-Infinitum/Ad-Nauseum throughout the guide - lol) you should now indeed have a Smooth-Performance SKYRIM Install with [/color][/font][color=#d8d8d8]NO-STUTTER/LAG/CDT/FREEZE/ILS [font=Verdana]while using ANY/ALL Mods you desire...

[/font][font=Verdana]HOWEVER, if for ANY reason you did not fully-understand any of the info in this GUIDE due to our not having made it Crystal-Clear (our intention is indeed to do so & make it as "simple-in-execution" as [/font]possible without compromising the guide's purpose) and/or something/anything did not "WORK" for you, please feel-free to post your Q's about any/all aspects of this Guide via the Comments-Section before you continue to actually perform the Instruction in this Guide - we'll reply to all posts (Questions and/or Comments) ASAP[/color]
